page.syntax: Output_String as C = WORD(C character,N word_number[,C separator[,N num_words]])

argument.name: word_number
argument.description: An integer that specifies which word to return, counting left to right. If the Word_Number is negative, WORD() counts words from right to left. Numeric

argument.name: separator
argument.description: Optional. Default = space (" "). The character that delimits words. If the optional Word_Delimiter parameter is not specified, a word is any sequence of one or more characters separated either by a space or the start or end of the string. If Word_Delimiter is specified, then Alpha Anywhere returns the strings that are delimited by the Word_Delimiter character. If Word_Delimiter is null (e.g ""), then WORD() returns a null value. Contrast with WORD2() which treats a null word delimiter as being the same as the default delimiter (e.g. space " ").

argument.name: num_words
argument.description: Optional. Default = 1. Specifies the number of words in the Input_String to return.

page.description: Returns a specified word(s) from a string.
page.discussion: WORD() returns one or more words, specified by the Word_Number and Word_Count and delimited by Word_Delimiter, from the supplied Input_String.
page.example: ? word("This is a test", 4) = "test" dim FULLNAME as C = "Di King" ? word(FULLNAME, 1) = "Di" dim FULLNAME as C = "John J. Smith" ? word(FULLNAME, w_count(FULLNAME)) = "Smith" ? word("the quick brown fox", -1) = "fox" ? word("John Smith, Alpha Software, BurlingtonMA01803", 3, ",") = "BurlingtonMA01803" ? word("now is the time", 2, " ", 3) = "is the time"
